definition: to make friends again/to renew old cordial relations
heavy/serious/to attach importance to
to repeat/repetition/again/re-/classifier: layer
surname Xiu
to decorate/to embellish/to repair/to build/to write/to cultivate/to study/to take (a class)
old/opposite: new 新/former/worn (with age)
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to

sentences.english: Or the time I sent that late night email to my ex-girlfriend that we should get back together.
sentences.chinese: 或者我在深夜給前女友發郵件，希望我們能重修舊好。

sentences.english: Was Sam really going to ditch the bar to move to L.A. with the reemerged Diane?
sentences.chinese: 山姆真的離開酒店去了洛杉磯和戴安重修舊好了嗎？

sentences.english: Maybe I should get back together with Naomi.
sentences.chinese: 也許我該回去和娜歐蜜重修舊好。

sentences.english: She would not even wish for any renewal of his attentions.
sentences.chinese: 她甚至根本不希望他再來重修舊好。

sentences.english: Friends managed to reconcile him with his wife after years of separation.
sentences.chinese: 年分居後朋友們設法使他與妻子重修舊好。

sentences.english: I am willing to listen to your feelings because I do care and I trust that we can work this out.
sentences.chinese: 我樂意傾聽你的感覺，因爲我相信我們可以重修舊好。

sentences.english: Now the couple is trying to work things out.
sentences.chinese: 如今夫婦倆正努力重修舊好。

sentences.english: Do you see any chance that we can get back together?
sentences.chinese: 你看我們可不可能重修舊好呢？

sentences.english: She would not even wish for any renewal of his attention.
sentences.chinese: 她甚至根本不希望他再來重修舊好。

sentences.english: I'll try my best to mend fences with him.
sentences.chinese: 我會盡全力與他重修舊好。

sentences.english: Still, every Christmas, she returned, hoping to rekindle some form of romance.
sentences.chinese: 每年聖誕節，她仍會回來，希望能重修舊好。

definition: to refute/to demolish (an argument, theory etc)
paper wedding (first year wedding anniversary)
proud and arrogant
willingly and gladly (idiom)
hiding place/hideout
conjoined twins
keenly felt pain/bitter anguish
to have a high notion of one's duty/to be highly principled
all crows are black (idiom)/evil people are bad all over the world
pinyin: tian1 xia4 wu1 ya1 yi1 ban1 hei1

definition: stupid/stubborn/pigheaded
lit. to assess the head and discuss the feet (idiom); minute criticism of a woman's appearance/fig. to find fault in minor details/nitpicking/overcritical
extreme benevolence, utmost duty (idiom); meticulous virtue and attention to duty
the rice is cooked/what's done is done/it's too late to change anything now (idiom)
pinyin: sheng1 mi3 zhu3 cheng2 shu2 fan4

definition: without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
the matter depends on the individual (idiom); it is a matter for your own effort/With effort, one can achieve anything.
the critical moment/life and death crisis
